definition: derailment (railway accident)/to leave the rails/fig. to overstep bounds/fig. to have an extramarital affair

to go out/to come out/to occur/to produce/to go beyond/to rise/to put forth/to happen/(used after a verb to indicate an outward direction or a positive result)/classifier for dramas, plays, operas etc

sentences.english: The principal Li Gongyan to enter the room her husband.
sentences.chinese: 委託人李紅妍進入丈夫出軌現場房間的瞬間。
我的出軌不過是種報復。
而有些男人則很遲纔出軌。

sentences.english: The trains are all to pot today because of a derailment farther down the line.
sentences.chinese: 今天的火車混亂不堪，因爲前面有一列火車出軌了。

sentences.english: Deceitful and despicable is one descriiption that wronged wives could apply to their cheating husbands.
sentences.chinese: 欺詐和卑鄙是受害妻子描述出軌丈夫的詞彙。

sentences.english: But trouble appears when your kneecap moves out of its track, or rubs up against its sides.
sentences.chinese: 如果你膝蓋移動出軌或蹭到了側面，那就會出問題。

sentences.english: One of the hardest things in coping with adultery is to actually forgive the marriage partner that has committed the adulterous act.
sentences.chinese: 真正爲另一半的出軌釋懷是極其艱難的。

sentences.english: Trains running on termite-eaten sleepers are running the risk of going off the rails.
sentences.chinese: 鐵路枕木如果受白蟻侵蝕，火車就有出軌的危險。

sentences.english: Sooo, who wants to die in a high-speed train derailment?
sentences.chinese: 那麼，誰想在出軌的高速火車裏？

sentences.english: Our husbands can still cheat on us and abandon us for flight attendants.
sentences.chinese: 你的丈夫很可能會爲了個空姐而出軌，繼而拋棄你。

sentences.english: The problem is, too much can derail it.
sentences.chinese: 現在的問題是，父母逼的太緊反而會讓孩子出軌。

sentences.english: An open switch will derail a train.
sentences.chinese: 轉轍器打開會使火車出軌。

sentences.english: The Ministry of Railways said train T195 derailed from the track before the collision.
sentences.chinese: 鐵道部稱T195次列車在相撞前已出軌。

sentences.english: Three coaches flung off the tracks by the force of the impact alone;
sentences.chinese: 僅只受撞擊的影響，就有五月節中秋年節車箱出軌。

sentences.english: The train went off the rails and fell into the valley.
Team members are conditioned to ignore risks that could be perceived as derailing the project.
sentences.chinese: 項目成員習慣於忽略在項目出軌時應該覺察到的風險。

definition: to be in a tangle/to nag
(coll.) (a woman's) close female friend/bestie/(originally written 閨密|闺密, an abbr. for 閨中密友|闺中密友)
to fall out with sb/to become hostile
lit. that person/fig. the person you have been looking for/Mr Right/the girl of one's dreams
to admit/to concede/to recognize/recognition (diplomatic, artistic etc)/to acknowledge
counterpart/other person involved/opposite side/other side/receiving party
to court/to go steady/to be dating
to kill oneself/to commit suicide/to attempt suicide
